label: A2B7C2_tI44_98_f_acde_f-001
title: Phase III Cd$_{2}$Re$_{2}$O$_{7}$ Structure
comments:
Cd$_{2}$Re$_{2}$O$_{7}$ exhibits a number of phases.  We will use the notation of (Kapcia, 2020) to describe them: \begin{itemize} \item Phase I: Above 200K the system takes on the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B2C7_cF88_227_c_d_af-001}{cubic pyrochlore ($E8_{1}$) structure}. \item Phase II: in the range 120-200K the system is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C2_tI44_119_i_acefgh_i-001}{tetragonal $I\overline{4}m2$ \#119 structure}. \item Phase III: in the range 80-120K the system is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C2_tI44_98_f_acde_f-001}{tetragonal $I4_{1}22$ \#98 structure} (this structure). \item Phase IV: (Kapcia, 2020) did a first-principles study of this system and found that below 80K Phase III develops a soft phonon mode which transforms the system into an \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C2_oF88_22_k_acefghij_k-001}{orthorhombic $F222$ \#22 structure}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 There are many issues with all of these structures (Norman, 2020): \begin{itemize} \item Phases II, III, and IV are all close to phase I.  If we loosen the tolerance using AFLOW-SYM or FINDSYM the structures are seen to be equivalent to cubic pyrochlore. \item Using the default tolerance, Phase II and Phase IV are equivalent. \end{itemize}
